intro: Austroderia toetoe, commonly known as the silver toetoe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its silver-gray leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, often in sandy or rocky soils. It is an important component of New Zealand's native flora and plays a role in stabilizing coastal environments. Austroderia toetoe is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
